title.narrative: Road Sector Governance and Maintenance Project

description.narrative:
The Lao Road Sector Governance and Maintenance Project will improve the delivery of public service in road asset management. It will cultivate sustainable and efficient road asset management practices by strengthening governance and capacity in planning, financing, and implementing routine and periodic road maintenance. The project will rehabilitate and maintain a total of 327 kilometers (km) of national and local roads in the provinces of Salavan, Xekong and Attapu. It will contribute to the achievement of the government's goal of improving road asset management.
The expected impact of the project will be delivery of public services in road asset management improved. The outcome will be sustainable road maintenance implemented in the provinces of Salavan, Xekong and Attapu. The project will consist of three outputs, (1) governance and practice for road asset management improved; (2) institutional capacity for road asset management strengthened; and (3) road asset rehabilitation and maintenance completed.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Sustainable road maintenance in the provinces of Salavan, Xekong and Attapu achieved.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
c. Average daily traffic on all project roads increased to 30,000 passenger car units (pcu) (21,600 pcu's in 2014)

description.narrative: Sustainable road maintenance in the provinces of Salavan, Xekong and Attapu achieved.

title.narrative: a. Percentage of national roads in good condition in target provinces increased to 60% (baseline 40% in 2014)

description.narrative: Sustainable road maintenance in the provinces of Salavan, Xekong and Attapu achieved.

title.narrative: b. Percentage of local roads in good condition in target provinces increased to 20% (baseline 6% in 2014)

description.narrative: Sustainable road maintenance in the provinces of Salavan, Xekong and Attapu achieved.
